title: random failures to move files or folders from LOCAL FOLDERS to Main emails.
creator: steve.fritts
content: I'm on latest T-bird 140.7.0-ESR 64-bit. I have random failures when trying to move individual files or folders from LOCAL FOLDERS back to MAIN emails. Moves some, sometimes, then won't move, or will move some but not all, and often corrupts the files back into Main folder. I only use one email under T-Bird. This has happened for years, but I have been judicious about moving files and lived with it. But it's still a problem that I would have thought something like this would have been fixed long ago? .The formatting of LOCAL FOLDERS & FILES in LOCAL FOLDERS seems different & convoluted vs. a straightforward formatting in MAIN where I can easily move withing Microsoft file management. But trying to reconfigure and COPY or MOVE Files or Folders from LOCAL is very problematic.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;os:win-10 64-bit but the problems have occurred from WIN-7

title: Downloading new messages stopped working two days ago.  Sending works.
creator: dorval
content:
I spent hours today with Rogers/Shaw support with nothing but a waste of my time. At the end they blame Tbird and were totally useless in helping. Thunderbird was fully working two days ago and I made no changes to anything. I am using the latest Tbird version. Today I uninstalled it and reinstalled with no change. I hate Rogers/Shaw but want to keep my email ID that I have used for many years.

I suspect this is password issue caused by Rogers but I can't identify it and as I said ROgers support was a waste of time. On the support chat the previous day they said they had a "back end" issue but now say that was fixed.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;os:WIndows 10 with registration for updates for one more year.

title: appearance on screen
creator: dougandsarah
content: Hi, I have recently had a problem with one of our cats walking on my keyboard. Previously the Thunderbird page had two panels, the top one listing emails in date order and the bottom one displaying the message I had highlighted on the top panel. Now I have the top panel which is fine but I can't get the bottom panel. Can you help please? Douglas.
